title: RNG should not be apart of a champions Kit
body:
Namely talking about {{champion:114}}  and {{champion:23}} early on in the game Tryn's crit passive (unlike jhins that's guarenteed on the 4th hit) should not be there. 

Randomly hitting crits early on is bad game design and makes it so if you fight him head on there's either a chance he loses because of RNG or you do and that's just stupid

Moving on to Fiora her passive vital placments play a big part in how passive or aggressive she'll be and how you need to position yourself. That being said if a vital is facing directly at her she's either gonna get free %hp true damage (why though?) and heal (but why?) or you have to run stupidly far back and miss cs to deal with it. 

RNG should not be in a game like this at all.

replies.body: Riot has been debating removing crit entirely for years, but the consensus seems to be that it would be more of a balance nightmare than it is worth.

>That being said if a vital is facing directly at her she's either gonna get free %hp true damage (why though?) and heal (but why?) 

But why does a champs kit do something? What is the point of the but why’s? “Ugh why does this champions kit do damage ugh what the fuck!”

This complaint makes no sense. And Fioras vitals follow a pattern. The first viral always spawns facing blue base, then it’ll be back or down, then front or up. It never spawns unfairly, so once a fight starts it’s quite possible to keep her away from it. And if she Qs aggressively for it in lane she can be punished.
